title: Action Day

first-time-popup.title: Welcome to Action Day
first-time-popup.description: These are days to take care of the practical stuff. Small steps that support your body and show real progress. <0>Each one counts.</0>

day-2.title:
Day 2 
 Blood Pressure
day-2.description: <0>Alcohol raises your blood pressure by tightening blood vessels and spiking stress hormones</0>. We're taking a baseline today so you can see the amazing difference later. Trust us, it's worth tracking.

how-to-do-it.title: How to do it:
description: Head to your nearest drugstore or grab a blood pressure monitor for home.

day-9.title:
Day 9
 Sugar Cleanse Awareness
day-9.description: Your brain might be hunting for sugar to replace the dopamine hit from alcohol. Totally normal. <0>Catching this pattern helps you stay ahead of cravings.</0>

how-to-do-it.title: How to do it:
description: Try cutting back on added sugars today or kick off a gentle cleanse
Pay attention to when those sweet cravings hit
Just notice, no need to be perfect

day-16.title:
Day 16
 Coach/Psychologist Appointment
day-16.description: Working with a professional gives you <0>tools to navigate cravings, identify triggers, and handle whatever life throws at you</0>. It's not about needing to be 'fixed,' it's about having support that actually works.

how-to-do-it.title: How to do it:
description: Book or attend a session with a licensed therapist, psychologist, or certified coach

day-23.title:
Day 23
 Set Up Doctor Appointment
day-23.description: Your physical health matters just as much as everything else. <0>A check-in with your doctor helps you see the full picture</0>. When's the last time you went? No judgment, just care.

how-to-do-it.title: How to do it:
description: Schedule an appointment with your GP for a wellness check, labs, whatever feels right

day-30.title:
Day 30
 Blood Pressure Re-Check
day-30.description: Ready to see what's changed? Your body's been healing behind the scenes. Let's compare today's numbers to Day 2 and <0>celebrate how far you've come.</0>

how-to-do-it.title: How to do it:
description: Take your blood pressure again (at the drugstore or at home)
Notice the difference, even small drops matter

normal.title: Normal Blood Pressure
normal.description: You're doing great. Your body's in a healthy place.

elevated.title: Elevated Blood Pressure
elevated.description: A little high, but small changes can help bring it down.

high-stage-1.title: High Blood Pressure: Stage 1
high-stage-1.description: Worth keeping an eye on. Maybe chat with your doctor about it.

high-stage-2.title: High Blood Pressure: Stage 2
high-stage-2.description: This is on the higher side. It's a good idea to talk with your doctor.

hypertensive-crisis.title: Hypertensive Crisis
hypertensive-crisis.description: This needs immediate attention. Please get medical help right away.

you-re-staying-healthy-description: Your blood pressure is still in a great range. You're maintaining what's working. That's a win.
you-improved-description: These are days to take care of the practical stuff. Small steps that support your body and show real progress. Each one counts.
holding-steady-description: No change yet, but your body might be adjusting in ways you can't see. Keep showing up.
let-s-check-in-description: Your numbers went up. Could be stress, sleep, or something else. Worth talking to your doctor about it.
we-ll-check-back-in-later-to-see-your-pr: We'll check back in later to see your progress.

validation.systolic-integer: Systolic must be a whole number
validation.systolic-min: Systolic must be at least 70 mmHg
validation.systolic-max: Systolic must be no more than 200 mmHg
validation.diastolic-integer: Diastolic must be a whole number
validation.diastolic-min: Diastolic must be at least 40 mmHg
validation.diastolic-max: Diastolic must be no more than 130 mmHg
